channel.title: Halloween
channel.description:
All Hallows Eve, when the boundary between the worlds of the living and the dead is blurred, a magical time when things happen, when even a gentle breeze pushing dark clouds in front of the moon seems the breath of some forgotten god of evil, a day where American children exercise for a few hours and then become even more obese in the ensuing feast. A strange day, in short, for all of us.
What are your plans this Halloween? Going trick-or-treating? Too old? Going to a costume party?
I have to stay home and give out treats this year, but I'm still dressing up. I don't quite know what I'm going to be, but it's going to evoke fear and possibly nausea! I will post pictures, tomorrow. Anyone else who is going to be in costume, whether for candy-gathering or partying or whether you just dress up like a weirdo on a daily basis because you're a freak, or whatever, should post their costumes too.

item.title: Halloween
item.dc:creator: @Tree Tree
item.description:
@Tree wrote:

Well i’m here to tell you the story of my Halloween. It all started when i was invited to a mates birthday get together. I went thirds in a carton and the night started rather nicely. After a while, we all decided to go for a walk. I had seen a family member earlier who knew of an open house party in the same area.

So we got half way and then one of our group passed out (he had a whole bottle of straight Jim Beam). They stopped and i went ahead. After an hour or two at the party and multiple free drinks, i then realized i had ditched my mates and a few were slightly shitty at me.

I started walking back but then passed out on the sidewalk. A few people from the party helped me up and for some strange reason, the idea of going back to my mates was horrible. I rang up another friend that was around the area and slept there on a blanketless bed. She wasn’t home so it was pretty strange.

I had an excellent night and no females were required.

Read full topic
